entry.title: Pet Loss Support : Goodbye to My Famous Ferret Moose Who Went Viral!
Blast from the Past / 1983: Seeking the owner of a lost ferret - Lewiston Morning Tribune
entry.summary: Ed Stamper holds a pet ferret found in his Lewiston neighborhood in this Patrick Sullivan photo published in the Jan. 23, 1983, Lewiston Tribune. The ferret had wandered into the yard of Stamper's neighbor, and the two had been trying to find the animal's owner for the last five days. Readers who would like to share their historical photos (20 years or older) from throughout the region may do so by emailing them to blasts@lmtribune.com or submitting them to: Blast from the Past, P.O. Box 957, Lewiston, ID 83501. Questions? Call Jeanne M. DePaul at (208) 848-2221. Patrick Sullivan/Tribune

entry.title: Around East County: Mink found at shelter mistaken at first for a ferret - East Bay Times
entry.summary: When a volunteer from Antioch Animal Services came into their building and said she saw what appeared to be a sick domesticated ferret on the ground outside in the parking lot, staffers quickly went into action to investigate and corral the little guy to help him. As it turned out, however, what they found in the parking lot wasnâ€™t one of the playful, mischievous brown-pelted animals but instead one of their wild distant cousins called a mink. â€œAt first, we did think it was a ferret,â€ said Melissa Ethridge from Antioch Animal Services. â€œWe kept him warm and comfortable overnight until another volunteer came in and said they thought it was a mink.â€ It turns out that minks and ferrets do really look quite alike. Theyâ€™re both from the mustelid family, along with polecats, weasels, badgers, otâ€¦

entry.title: Rathlin Island: RSPB searches for a ferret-catcher - Yahoo News
entry.summary: If the chance to work in one of Northern Ireland's most beautiful landscapes appeals to you, you may be in luck.The Royal Society for the Protection of Birds (RSPB) is currently looking for someone to do just that.What's the role? Co-ordinating the eradication of Rathlin Island's ferret and rat populations.Seabirds and other wildlife on the island off the Antrim coast are on the decline because of non-native ferrets.As part of a five-year project the RSPB now needs a ferret trapping co-ordinator.Marina McMullan, who lives on the island and is a member of Rathlin Development Community Association, said ferrets had been a problem for more than 40 years as they decimate the local wildlife.She said the job opportunity would bring employment to the community, adding "every penny counts for locaâ€¦

entry.title: Hello lovely people. I just want to say thank you for following my journey with ferrets these last 8 years. It is such a blessin...
entry.summary: Hello lovely people. I just want to say thank you for following my journey with ferrets these last 8 years. It is such a blessing to be able to geek out about ferrets with you all. I have always loved animals but like I've said before, I think all along I was just looking for a ferret! They are the perfect pet in so many ways. Don't you agree? Was anyone else just looking for ferrets all along too? Why do they fit us so perfectly? Love you all! P.S. the sweatshirt in this picture is from my Etsy shop (link in bio)! It says 'Ferrets' in the style of the Friends TV show logo. #ferret #ferrets #ferretsofinstagram(Feed generated with FetchRSS)

entry.title: Watch Where You Step: Ferrets love to sleep in clothes that smell like you. Dirty clothes smell the strongest so donâ€™t be surpri...
entry.summary: Watch Where You Step: Ferrets love to sleep in clothes that smell like you. Dirty clothes smell the strongest so donâ€™t be surprised if you find your ferret curled up in the pajama pants you threw on the floor. This can become dangerous when you keep clothes scattered all over your floor. Think of it like a â€˜ferret mine fieldâ€™. Any piece of clothing could contain a ferret and if you step on them, you can cause serious injury. You have two options for this. You can either change your habits and keep all clothing off the floor, or you can shuffle your feet when you walk instead of stepping. #ferret #ferretgram #ferrets #instaferret #ferretism #ferretsofinstagram #ãƒ•ã‚§ãƒ¬ãƒƒãƒˆ #ferretlove #Ñ…Ð¾Ñ€ÐµÐº #ferretlife #furet #frettchen #huron #fuzzbutt(Feed generated with FetchRSS)

entry.title:
Let's talk about a common ferret illness today:
ECE (Epizootic catarrhal enteritis) is an inflammation of the intestinal lining...
entry.summary: Let's talk about a common ferret illness today: ECE (Epizootic catarrhal enteritis) is an inflammation of the intestinal lining that if left untreated can cause liver damage and death; it is a common and life-threatening illness in ferrets that is extremely contagious! It's nickname in the ferret community is 'green-slime'. Has anybody here had experience with this one? What was it like? Thank you for sharing! #ferret #ferrets #ferretinstagram(Feed generated with FetchRSS)

entry.summary: Do you guys use anything like this to contain your ferrets when you take them to outdoor spaces? I think it's crucial to get something that zips (vs. velcro or doesn't have a bottom). What do you guys think? This particular one is available in The Modern Ferret Amazon shop if you are looking for a pretty solid one. #ferret #ferrets #ferretsofinstagram(Feed generated with FetchRSS)
